text.content: Start with the sauce. Clean and chop the onion, then sauté it in a pot with hot olive oil. Cook for a couple of minutes, stirring, then add the tomato passata.
Season with salt and add basil leaves. Rinse the container with a little water and add it to the pot. Simmer for 45-50 minutes. Meanwhile, dice the mozzarella.
Prepare the eggplants: wash and trim them. Slice them lengthwise into 4-5 mm thick pieces. Dry thoroughly with paper towels. Fry the eggplant slices in hot oil at 170°C, a few at a time.
Once lightly golden, drain on a tray lined with absorbent paper. Add more paper as needed and place the fried eggplants on top.
Assemble the parmigiana: pour some sauce into a 20x30 cm baking dish. Arrange the eggplant slices for the first layer, then cover with tomato sauce.
Sprinkle with mozzarella cubes, grated Parmigiano, and basil leaves.
Repeat the layers with tomato sauce, eggplant, cheeses, and basil leaves. Continue until you reach the final eggplant layer.
Finish with the remaining mozzarella cubes and grated Parmigiano Reggiano. Bake in a preheated static oven at 200°C for about 30 minutes. Let it rest for 15-20 minutes before serving.
